channel.title: T2 problem with MoparScape client
channel.description:
On my server I don't know what I did, but people using moparscape client will get T2'd out.
Yet if they use a clean nothing added, refractored client, they connect just fine.
What could be the reasons of this?
Here is the T2 error: [code] Error: T2 - 126,126,126 - 12,0,0 - 64,121,101,108,64,112,117,114,101,10,72,-43, [/code]
Thanks guys.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 13, 2009, 09:38:20 pm[/size][hr]anyone?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 14, 2009, 11:00:03 am[/size][hr]Please help.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 15, 2009, 01:49:59 pm[/size][hr]Bump[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 15, 2009, 07:37:09 pm[/size][hr]halp guis=[[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 17, 2009, 01:02:05 am[/size][hr]Anyone know what to do?

item.title: T2 problem with MoparScape client
item.dc:creator: @teken2 teken2
item.description:
@teken2 wrote:

Thanks for the help guys you got me closer to the problem.

But does it appear like anything is wrong with my sendMessage void?

public void sendMessage(String s) { outStream.createFrameVarSize(253); outStream.writeString(s); outStream.endFrameVarSize(); }

Thank you so much,

greatly appreciated the help.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 18, 2009, 12:41:50 pm[/size][hr]Actually I found it.
sendFrame126(

Only thing is… I have no idea what to do now.:\

What do I do now guys?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 18, 2009, 05:25:36 pm[/size][hr]Guys I fixed it! I found out it was my modified quest list. It sent quite a few interfaces I bet that’s what the problem was! Thank you all so much for all the help in diagnosing my problem. =)

Read full topic

item.title: T2 problem with MoparScape client
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

Usually t2 errors in a client are because of interfaces/animations/gfx’s not added to the client, but displayed in the server. The T2 error you have contains 126 as the first error number - this is the frame/packet that causes the error. I’m not aware of a packet 126, but frame 126 is the frame to set text onto interfaces, maybe this is the problem?

Read full topic

item.title: T2 problem with MoparScape client
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Hmm, looks like something wrong with your sendMessage void.

Read full topic
